faq.question: How long does a residential installation for a new house take?
faq.answer: The time depends on size and complexity, but most residential projects are completed in 1 to 3 business days.

faq.question: What types of installations do you perform?
faq.answer: We make any dream, project or idea you have in mind a reality, from residential to commercial installations.

faq.question: Can I request a quote without commitment?
faq.answer: Of course! All our quotes are free and without commitment.

faq.question: Do you work with materials from a specific brand?
faq.answer: No, materials vary according to the customer's budget or needs, however in our quotes we will always recommend the right ones for your job.

faq.question: Can you advise me on the electrical design of my home?
faq.answer: Yes, our team can help you plan and optimize the electrical design for greater efficiency and safety.

faq.question: Can I schedule a technical visit before hiring?
faq.answer: Yes, we can coordinate a technical visit to evaluate your project and provide you with the best advice without commitment.

sharedSpecs.title: All our air conditioners have the following specifications

inverter.title: Inverter AC
inverter.subtitle: VARIABLE SPEED
inverter.description: The compressor adjusts its speed continuously, maintaining stable temperature without turning off completely. This translates into greater comfort and lower consumption.
advantages: Save between 40% and 60% on your electricity bill
Longer lifespan of the compressor and equipment
Lower environmental impact and carbon footprint

conventional.title: Conventional AC
conventional.subtitle: FIXED SPEED
conventional.description: The compressor operates at a fixed speed, turning on and off repeatedly to regulate temperature. It's a proven technology and more economical to acquire.
advantages: More accessible and economical purchase price
Wide availability of spare parts in the market
Simpler and faster installation and repair
Good option for sporadic or temporary use

inverter.title: Choose Inverter if...
items: You use the AC more than 6 hours a day
You want to save on electricity bills

conventional.title: Choose Conventional if...
items: You use the AC few hours a day
It's for temporary or sporadic use
